My fannish space, where I ramble about everything and nothings. And although, yes, it's fannish space, and I'll squee and yay about said fandoms, I also take certain things very seriously so someties, I will post about it.  
I'm Méxican, I'm a woman, I'm an english teacher and an editor so a bit of everything shows up here.

title: Upperdeck's Marvel Masterpieces 2018 cards
body:
Upperdeck’s Marvel Masterpieces 2018 cards

This year I was honored to work in the Marvel Masterpieces 2018 card set put out by Upperdeck with 59 cards. I can’t tell you how much I squeed the second I got the cards, and how hard it was to pick JUST 59 characters because Marvel is probably my favorite Superhero comic universe of all time.

So here are 27 of those 59 cards (c’mon, I have to leave some to surprise anyone who gets them in their…

View On WordPress

blog.name: super-hero-confessions
blog.title: Super-Hero-Confessions
blog.description:
Super-hero-confessions is a blog where you can submit your confessions/personal opinions about any of the super hero movies, comics, television shows, cartoons, etc.

The confessions that are posted are those that are submitted; not the opinions of the blog owners. All the confessions will be anonymous when posted. Feel free to submit photos along with your confession if you would like as well.

If you want us to see a post tag it with either #superheroconfessions or #superhero confessions

summary: I’m desperately trying not to think about the fact at the end of Captain Marvel we’re gonna have to see ‘in Memory of Stan Lee’...
body: I’m desperately trying not to think about the fact at the end of Captain Marvel we’re gonna have to see ‘in Memory of Stan Lee’ but all I can think about is how at the end of Captain Marvel we’re all gonna have to see ‘in Memory of Stan Lee’ and it breaks my heart more than Infinity War and the end of Ant-Man and the Wasp ever could

summary: The Stan Lee Marvel cameos we can still look forward to
title: The Stan Lee Marvel cameos we can still look forward to
body:
Marvel fans look forward to Stan Lee’s cameos as much as they look forward to seeing their favourite superheroes in action but after the comic icon’s death, it means they will soon come to an end.

The 95-year-old passed away this week having gifted the world with several of its most popular heroes – from Spider-Man to the Fantastic Four – and appearing in practically every Marvel film for the last thirty years.

There are a shed load of superheroes movies to come from Fox, Sony and, of course, Marvel Studios but the question is: which film will feature Lee’s last cameo appearance?

Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse – CONFIRMED


Sony’s animated Spider-Man feature film, centered on Miles Morales, has Stan Lee appear in the first act of the film playing the owner of a costume shop.

Watch the movie in cinemas from December 14

Captain Marvel – CONFIRMED


Lee’s agent confirmed that he appears in the Brie Larson-led solo film, set in 90s Los Angeles.

Watch the film in cinemas from March 8, 2019

Avengers 4 – CONFIRMED

The Russo Brothers confirmed that Stan filmed his cameo with Joe telling the BBC how it went down.

“Typically we try to get him out — he doesn’t love to fly — so we try to get him out for his cameos around the same time,” the Avengers 4 co-director explained. “So if we have other movies shooting on the same lot that we’re on, for instance, Ant-Man 2 or Avengers 4, we group his cameos together and then move him from one set to the next and kind of get him through his cameos in one day.”

Watch the film in cinemas from May 3, 2019

Dark Phoenix – UNCONFIRMED


According to EW, a source says that Lee did not film a cameo for the latest X-Men movie.

Watch the film in cinemas from June 7, 2019

Spider-Man: Far From Home – UNCONFIRMED

Tom Holland’s second Spider-Man film finished production last month but it’s unclear if Lee filmed a cameo in that time given his deteriorating health.

It would have certainly been a fitting way to say goodbye as Peter Parker is one his greatest and most beloved co-creations.

Watch the film in cinemas from July 5, 2019

The New Mutants –  UNCONFIRMED


Josh Boones’ horror-tinged X-Men spin-off has finished production after several months of reshoots though Fox has not confirmed if Lee has a cameo.

Watch the film in cinemas from August 2, 2019

READ MORE
Stan Lee dies aged 95
First Toy Story 4 teaser revealed
Pixar scenes that always make you cry

Marvel fans look forward to Stan Lee’s cameos as much as they look forward to seeing their favourite superheroes in action but after the comic icon’s death, it means they will soon come to an end.

The 95-year-old passed away this week having gifted the world with several of its most popular heroes – from Spider-Man to the Fantastic Four – and appearing in practically every Marvel film for the last thirty years.

There are a shed load of superheroes movies to come from Fox, Sony and, of course, Marvel Studios but the question is: which film will feature Lee’s last cameo appearance?

Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse – CONFIRMED


Sony’s animated Spider-Man feature film, centered on Miles Morales, has Stan Lee appear in the first act of the film playing the owner of a costume shop.

Watch the movie in cinemas from December 14

Captain Marvel – CONFIRMED


Lee’s agent confirmed that he appears in the Brie Larson-led solo film, set in 90s Los Angeles.

Watch the film in cinemas from March 8, 2019

Avengers 4 – CONFIRMED

The sequel to ‘Avengers: Infinity War’ will have a Stan Lee cameo

The Russo Brothers confirmed that Stan filmed his cameo with Joe telling the BBC how it went down.

“Typically we try to get him out — he doesn’t love to fly — so we try to get him out for his cameos around the same time,” the Avengers 4 co-director explained. “So if we have other movies shooting on the same lot that we’re on, for instance, Ant-Man 2 or Avengers 4, we group his cameos together and then move him from one set to the next and kind of get him through his cameos in one day.”

Watch the film in cinemas from May 3, 2019

Dark Phoenix – UNCONFIRMED


According to EW, a source says that Lee did not film a cameo for the latest X-Men movie.

Watch the film in cinemas from June 7, 2019

Spider-Man: Far From Home – UNCONFIRMED

Spider-Man: Far From Home’s Tom Holland debuts his new suit

Tom Holland’s second Spider-Man film finished production last month but it’s unclear if Lee filmed a cameo in that time given his deteriorating health.

It would have certainly been a fitting way to say goodbye as Peter Parker is one his greatest and most beloved co-creations.

Watch the film in cinemas from July 5, 2019

The New Mutants –  UNCONFIRMED


Josh Boones’ horror-tinged X-Men spin-off has finished production after several months of reshoots though Fox has not confirmed if Lee has a cameo.

Watch the film in cinemas from August 2, 2019

summary: "I used to be embarrassed because I was just a comic-book writer while other people were building bridges or going on to medical...
caption: “I used to be embarrassed because I was just a comic-book writer while other people were building bridges or going on to medical careers. And then I began to realize: entertainment is one of the most important things in people’s lives. Without it they might go off the deep end. I feel that if you’re able to entertain people, you’re doing a good thing.” - Stan Lee

reblog.comment: “I used to be embarrassed because I was just a comic-book writer while other people were building bridges or going on to medical careers. And then I began to realize: entertainment is one of the most important things in people’s lives. Without it they might go off the deep end. I feel that if you’re able to entertain people, you’re doing a good thing.” - Stan Lee

summary: Concept: Shazam may look like a Poster Boy Scout, but he very much deals with and stops Batman-esque inner city problems, and it...
body:
Concept: Shazam may look like a Poster Boy Scout, but he very much deals with and stops Batman-esque inner city problems, and it is a juxtaposition that leaves his colleagues (and reporters) with whiplash.

Like, Billy Batson is some lil street rat that squats in abandoned or really shifty buildings, so his neighbors are most likely other homeless folks and youths or really poor families and individuals (varying between veterans, minorities, mentally ill, kicked out teens or runaways, and sex workers). And while news often show Captain Marvel stopping alien invasions or rescuing people from burning buildings or fighting supervillains, he also frequently stops crime that is (unknowing to others) very close to home.

He helps poor old ladies who dont know a lick of English move couches. He assists at multiple shelters that need the extra muscle and hands (and hey, he gets a meal). He entertains the little ones there, too. He stops robberies at the shitty corner store. But also? He stops shitty cops when they’re abusing an innocent man. He detains douchebags that try to harass sex workers (sometimes hes even called down to help escort some ladies home from work). Captain helps wherever he can and often it’s in places and with people that majority of society snubs.

And this can cause problems: tabloids claiming that he visits strip clubs, that hes obstructing the law, that he aids “illegals over citizens”, etc etc. Just that nasty shit because now he doesn’t fit their perspective of a hero for the (right kind of) people. But what does he do? Well, if a reporter or cameras show his face he will tell the Truth, that truth is full of Good and Wisdom and people who see/meet him Know That, he is Believed. And that seems really farfetched but then the JL watch and read, and yeah, he is Totally The Real Deal Good Hero, and they don’t know How he does that, how he exudes that almost fairy tale charm (Batman actually is investigating this and believes it to be magic but doesn’t have Proof).

So, what I’m saying is, Shazam may look like Superman, but his city can be as terrible as Batman’s.

Captain helps wherever he can and often it’s in places and with people that majority of society snubs.

And this can cause problems: tabloids claiming that he visits strip clubs, that hes obstructing the law, that he aids “illegals over citizens”, etc etc. Just that nasty shit because now he doesn’t fit their perspective of a hero for the (right kind of) people. But what does he do? Well, if a reporter or cameras show his face he will tell the Truth, that truth is full of Good and Wisdom and people who see/meet him Know That, he is Believed. And that seems really farfetched but then the JL watch and read, and yeah, he is Totally The Real Deal Good Hero, and they don’t know How he does that, how he exudes that almost fairy tale charm (Batman actually is investigating this and believes it to be magic but doesn’t have Proof).

So, what I’m saying is, Shazam may look like Superman, but his city can be as terrible as Batman’s.

summary: wow. I can’t believe this has happened. Thank you so much for everything you did, Mr. Stan Lee. You gave us the irreplaceable...
body:
wow. I can’t believe this has happened. Thank you so much for everything you did, Mr. Stan Lee. You gave us the irreplaceable gift of imagination, and little kids across the globe have looked to the sky believing they could fly like the amazing characters you created. Your comics, movies, and stories let us escape reality and enter an extraordinary world where anything was possible, and they connected so many people. You were truly an inspiration to us all. Because of you, I still believe in heroes.

Thanks for the memories, sir. Rest in Power 🙏 Excelsior!

blog.name: cinematografieliebhaber
blog.title: Cinematografieliebhaber
blog.description:
Ich liebe Theater und Kinofilme schon seit ich ein kleiner Junge war. Ich hatte das Glück, selbst einmal reinschnuppern zu können und kenne daher auch den Blick hinter die Kulissen. Zu meinen Lieblingsfilmen gehören Klassiker wie Der Pate I + II, Casablanca, Western wie Zwei glorreiche Halunken, Spiel mir das Lied vom Tod, österreichische Filme wie Der Bockerer, Extrablatt, aber auch Zeichentrickflime wie Das letzte Einhorn, Mary & Max, Literaturverfilmungen wie Die Verurteilten, Komödien wie Sein oder Nichtsein, Don Camillo und Peppone, Serial Mom und viele mehr.... 

Ich bin also regelmäßiger Besucher in Kinos und werde euch über diese Besuche erzählen.

summary: Shazam! beinhaltet das mehrteilige Comeback von Captain Marvel alias Shazam!, einem der mächtigsten Helden des DC Universums,...
caption: Shazam! beinhaltet das mehrteilige Comeback von Captain Marvel alias Shazam!, einem der mächtigsten Helden des DC Universums, dessen Herz reiner ist als das von Superman. Das ist kein Wunder, steckt hinter diesem Helden doch der Waisenjunge Billy Batson. Der Superheld hat seine Karriere ursprünglich in den 40er Jahren bei Fawcett Comics begonnen und zählt mit zu den – wenn auch gegenwärtig eher unbekannten – Ikonen der Golden Ages der Superhelden.
